text:
*[Bug 18752] New: Manual page for is.atomic doc should mention change of is.atomic(NULL) in 4.4.0*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18752>

            Bug ID: 18752
           Summary: Manual page for is.atomic doc should mention change of
                    is.atomic(NULL) in 4.4.0
           Product: R
           Version: R 4.4.x
          Hardware: All
                OS: All
            Status: UNCONFIRMED
          Severity: normal
          Priority: P5
         Component: Documentation
          Assignee: <mailto:R-core@R-project.org|R-core@R-project.org>
          Reporter: <mailto:antalk2@gmail.com|antalk2@gmail.com>

Since R version 4.4.0, is.atomic(NULL) is FALSE.
It was TRUE before.

Please include this in the manual.

Note: deprecating base::is.atomic in favor of a new name, 
for example base::is_atomic could have
avoided silently changing the meaning of existing code.

text:
*[Bug 18753] New: summaryRprof: Unexpected unit for memory profiling*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18753>

            Bug ID: 18753
           Summary: summaryRprof: Unexpected unit for memory profiling
           Product: R
           Version: R 4.4.x
          Hardware: x86_64/x64/amd64 (64-bit)
                OS: Windows 64-bit
            Status: UNCONFIRMED
          Severity: minor
          Priority: P5
         Component: Documentation
          Assignee: <mailto:R-core@R-project.org|R-core@R-project.org>
          Reporter: <mailto:sauer@imbi.uni-heidelberg.de|sauer@imbi.uni-heidelberg.de>

Created attachment 3366
  --> <https://bugs.r-project.org/attachment.cgi?id=3366&action=edit>
Patch for changing Mb to MiB in documentation of summaryRprof()

According to the documentation ?summaryRprof, the option `memory = "both"`
reports "memory consumption in Mb in addition to the timings", i.e. the unit is
megabytes. However, looking at the source code
(<https://github.com/wch/r-source/blob/18652de8890d89563b923ff58b45ccb04d9955fe/src/library/utils/R/summRprof.R#L170>)
suggests that memory is reported in mebibytes (division by 1048576 and not by
100000). 

In line with BUg 18297, it should be in MiB and not in MB.

A patch suggestion is supplied below.

Patch for changing Mb to MiB in documentation of summaryRprof()

According to the documentation ?summaryRprof, the option

reports "memory consumption in Mb in addition to the timings", i.e. the unit is
megabytes. However, looking at the source code
(

)
suggests that memory is reported in mebibytes (division by 1048576 and not by
100000). 

In line with BUg 18297, it should be in MiB and not in MB.

A patch suggestion is supplied below.
